.. _`Pandas Merge`:

PANDAS MERGE
============

Merge salmon quant.sf files





Example
-------

This meta-wrapper can be used in the following way:

.. code-block:: python

    rule pandas_merge_salmon_tr:
        input:
            quant = expand("{sample}/quant.sf", sample=["A", "B"]),
            tx2gene = "tx2gene.tsv"
        output:
            tsv = "table_tr.tsv"
        message:
            "Testing pandas merge salmon"
        log:
            "logs/pandas_merge_salmon.log"
        wrapper:
            "0.66.0-225-gb77af9ed/bio/pandas/salmon"


    rule pandas_merge_salmon_tr_positions:
        input:
            quant = expand("{sample}/quant.sf", sample=["A", "B"]),
            tx2gene = "tx2gene2.tsv"
        output:
            tsv = "table_tr_pos.tsv"
        message:
            "Testing pandas merge salmon"
        params:
            index_label = True
        log:
            "logs/pandas_merge_salmon.log"
        wrapper:
            "0.66.0-225-gb77af9ed/bio/pandas/salmon"


    rule pandas_merge_salmon_genes:
        input:
            quant = expand("{sample}/quant.genes.sf", sample=["A", "B"]),
            tx2gene = "tx2gene.tsv"
        output:
            tsv = "table_genes.tsv"
        message:
            "Testing pandas merge salmon"
        params:
            genes = True,
            index_label = True
        log:
            "logs/pandas_merge_salmon.log"
        wrapper:
            "0.66.0-225-gb77af9ed/bio/pandas/salmon"


    rule pandas_merge_salmon_genes_positions:
        input:
            quant = expand("{sample}/quant.genes.sf", sample=["A", "B"]),
            tx2gene = "tx2gene2.tsv"
        output:
            tsv = "table_genes_pos.tsv"
        message:
            "Testing pandas merge salmon"
        params:
            index_label = True,
            genes = True
        log:
            "logs/pandas_merge_salmon.log"
        wrapper:
            "0.66.0-225-gb77af9ed/bio/pandas/salmon"


Note that input, output and log file paths can be chosen freely.
When running with

.. code-block:: bash

    snakemake --use-conda

the software dependencies will be automatically deployed into an isolated environment before execution.



Notes
-----

Parameters:

* suffix: Suffix that is to be removed from sample identifier
* prefix: Prefix that is to be removed from sample identifier
* column: The column to keep in the merged table
* gencode: Remove patch from sample identifiers
* drop_na: Drop full NA targets
* drop_null: Drop full null targets
* genes: Work on genes and not on transcripts
* header: There is a header in the tx2gene table
* index_label: The index label in the tx2gene
